column4: Hey, Im trying to install my ATI driver and it says to make sure fglrx is not disabled and to run a script to open the file and one of the lines in the text body is: DISABLED_MODULES="ath_hal fc fglrx ltm nv" does that mean fglrx is disabled?
that means that ubuntu will not use build in fglrx
All I want to do is run wow
if you install drivers from ati.com then you should disable
Im using the walkthrugh on the ubuntu site
and it says to "make sure fglrx is not disabled"
Make sure fglrx is not disabled: sudogedit/etc/default/linux-restricted-modules-common
then yes, remove fglrx from DISABLED_MODULES
do I do that by simply removing the last text line
there should be DISABLED_MODULES without # bellow
but ati is bitch to use with Linux, I never actualy got my old radeon 9600 pro to work properly
